TITLE: 2005 ford taurus
ATTR: fuel: gas#odometer: 253000#title status: clean#transmission: automatic
MESSAGE: for sale is my 2005 ford taurus with 253xxx miles on it.  the car does look like its age and mileage; but it does start and drive.  i bought the car from a friend whose family owned it in northern michigan; who then sold it to me.  i have only owned the car since may; so i havent put many miles on it.  only reason i am selling is because i bought another vehicle.  i do not need to sell.  yes; i know the car is rough; which is why it is priced where it is.#good:#radio works; starts and runs; new wheel cylinders in the rear; new starter.#bad:#there is a hole in the drivers side floorboard a little bigger then a baseball; and there is only about half of the floor on the passengers side.  car is very rusty; and looks awful.  when the windshield is sprayed; sometimes a burning smell comes shortly after.  that is because there is a leak in the hose; and the washer fluid drops onto the motor.  after the car has been running a while; it shifts real hard out of first gear; and my friends said that when he drove it from detroit back to northern michigan; by the time it got off the freeway the car would not leave first gear until you let the car sit for a while.  car has a misfire on cylinders 1; 2 and 3 (i think its a bad head gasket; given the cylinders are all on the same bank).  im sure there is more; but i cant remember.  there is a reason the car is priced where it is.#for its condition and mileage; the car doesnt run too bad.  car was driven daily up until june 9nth.#please text or call me at 248 eight three eight 8 zero eight 2 between 3:30 pm and 9:00 pm during the week; and anytime on the weekend.  i do have class twice a week; so if i do not answer or respond immediately; i will get back to you as soon as i can.  any questions feel free to ask.  will also consider trades.  give me an offer; the worst i can do is say no.

MESSAGE: well taken care of auto. my brother (who is a very good mech.) bought this car from village ford in 2006 with 22;000 mi and drove it to 157;000. i bought it for my daughter in sept of 2013 and she drove it to 215;000 all the while getting regular maintenance and oil changes. some of the maintenance includes -- new master cylinder; rear brakes and both rear wheel cylinders on 9/4/14; new air conditioning compressor 6/27/16; new left front hub bearing 7/5/16; new alternator; rear struts; rear brake drums; rear brake shoes; and battery on 8/24/16; new starter motor on 9/21/16; heater hose assembly and anti freeze service on 11/1/16; new front rotors and pads on 6/20/17; new firestone firehawk all season performance radials put on 5/17; front end alignment done at belle tire in summer of 2016. this taurus does not blow blue oil smoke out the tail pipe; mainly because it has been taken care of. this car is a good driver and wouldnt have put over 3;600 dollars in repairs if i didnt think car was worth it. yes in has a lot of miles but this car has been well taken care of and still has many miles to go. i gave my daughter my ford fusion so this one is up for sale. car still appears nice and does have some rust around the rear wheel wells (show me a taurus of that year that doesnt) v6 automatic; car has working electric sunroof; a nice kenwood after market radio with usb and other plugins with remote; power steering and brakes; power mirrors; keyless entry; tilt steering wheel; lit vanity mirrors; working power windows; grey leather interior; folding center console so three people can sit up front if you wish; working icy cold air conditioning; rear defroster; information center showing miles to empty ect.; floor mats ft and rear; remote trunk release; have two remote key fobs and two keys. when i changed tires i kept the best tire with plenty of tread for a spare in case of a tire becoming damaged and beyond repair; it is in the trunk. clean interior and ready to go. front seat did have sheep skin covers but need to be cleaned and they are in the trunk. no major accidents while owned by me or my brother.

TITLE: 2009 ford taurus sel
ATTR: VIN: 1FAHP24W69G104690#condition: good#cylinders: 6 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 124000#paint color: white#size: full-size#title status: clean#transmission: automatic#type: sedan
MESSAGE: clean interior just detailed. heat and air conditioning work; automatic; doors; locks; windows; seats; am/fm radio with cd; wood paneling and digital clock for a luxury feel. v6 engine. fwd split folding rear seats. 4 brand new tires.#the sel model is powered by a 3.5-liter v-6 engine mated to a 6-speed automatic transmission. standard equipment on the base model includes an am/fm cd audio system with an mp3 input jack; climate control with rear-seat ducts; power drivers seat; fold-flat front passenger seat; extra sound insulation; halogen headlamps; and 17-inch wheels. the ford taurus sel and taurus limited with front- or all-wheel drive include more standard amenities such as a trip computer; leather and woodgrain trim and touches; power drivers seat; 17-inch aluminum wheels; premium audio system; automatic climate control; and sirius satellite radio.;#powertrain#the 2009 ford taurus is powered by a 3.5-liter v-6 engine producing 263 hp and 249 lb.-ft. of torque. it is mated to a 6-speed automatic transmission. the large family sedan earns a pzev (partial zero-emission vehicle) rating from the epa. fuel economy is estimated at 18 mpg city/28 mpg highway with front-wheel drive; and 17 mpg city/27 mpg highway with all-wheel drive.#safety#dual front air bags; seat-mounted front side air bags; and side curtain air bags for both rows are standard on every 2009 ford taurus. other standard safety features include traction control; abs; stability control; power-adjustable pedals; and an sos-post crash alert system that unlocks doors and activates the horn and emergency flashers if the air bags are deployed in an accident. a reverse collision sensing system is optional.#in national highway traffic safety administration (nhtsa) testing; the 2009 ford taurus earned 5-star ratings (the administrations highest rating) for all occupants in frontal and side-impact crash tests and 4 stars for rollover resistance. as mentioned earlier; the iihs hasnt rated the 2009 model yet; but the 2008 model with stability control was named a top safety pick by the institute.#technology#fords sync voice-activated hands-free communication and entertainment system; developed jointly with microsoft; is standard on the 2009 taurus limited and optional on sel models. sync integrates cell phones and media players; such as the mp3 player; with the vehicle using bluetooth technology and usb connectivity. sync-equipped taurus models feature an electro-chromic rearview mirror with compass and microphone features.

TITLE: 1996 ford taurus
ATTR: fuel: gas#title status: clean#transmission: automatic
MESSAGE: 96 taurus;  146;000 miles.  this car was the lil old ladys next door; then my father bought it; then i got it from my father so its always been well maintained.  clean title; always passes smog.  power windows; power door locks.  brand new goodyear eagle tires on the nicest rims from that era (off a mercury sable).   the interior is pretty clean.  the exterior has one dent on the drivers door (see pix)  and a couple scratches here and there but still cleans up nicely.  the transmission has been firm its entire life; not once has it slipped or done anything funny.  engine is a 3 liter v6 (the 12v pushrod engine is more bulletproof than the dohc engine in my opinion).  those are all the goods.  the one bad is that the a/c compressor clutch is starting to fail.  it makes a gnarly noise when the a/c is off but once you turn it on; the clutch engages and everything is normal.  the a/c blows pretty damn cold too.  its a pretty easy fix if youre mechanically inclined.   please take this off my hands and enjoy it to 200k miles!  i know itll do it; i just dont have the time.  call joe if interested:#show contact info

MESSAGE: for sale is a used 95 taurus wagon. i am selling it as i have replaced it with something bigger and no longer have a need for it. it does have its faults; its a 95 from illinois; and it has seen rust. however - it starts; and runs; and has heat; and a/c.#the car has the following features (with an explanation on what is good/ok/needs replacing)#3.8l v6 - good - oil change needed in the next 1500 miles - spark plugs changed around 125k miles with new platinum plugs; also replaced transmission fluid in process.#power windows - front windows work; rear windows do not; one rolls down but wont roll up; other does nothing - suspect bad switch. all windows have 35% window tint#power locks with remote keyless entry - all works great#electronic automatic climate control - works great#4 wheel disc brakes - the brakes do require a bit of force to use; however they stop very well; just needs more force than most newer cars - parking brake sticks - do not use as it will cause the driver caliper to stick#15 inch tires - ok; but needs replacing soon#am/fm/cassette stock ford radio with power antenna - fm does not work that well; tests great.#power moonroof - leaks during heavy rain storms on passenger side. also the console is a bit flimsy on the ceiling.#this car has served me well; and would make a great first car; or someone who is mechanically inclined could fix this thing up and have a reliable car.#i am selling it as-is. this car may run for another 500;000k miles; or it may run for 5 miles; it is a 22 year old car and has its faults. i havent driven it much in over a year. however it has sat in a garage during that storage time. i have moved it out finally to get it out and cleaned it out. i only have 1 set of keys for this; and it has 3 keys. 1 key for ignition; 1 for doors; and 1 for trunk/glove box; and a keyfob.#i am not looking for anyone to help me sell the car - so if you are calling with intention to help me sell the car - please know; this would be an excellent graduation gift! this is a nice car.#$1;600.00 cash only. this is priced well below blue book. please send me a note if you have any questions and thanks for looking!#ford; taurus; used car; car; auto; go cart; go kart

TITLE: 2004 ford taurus sel; 4dr sedan
ATTR: VIN: 1FAHP56S64G191186#condition: good#cylinders: 6 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 127000#paint color: black#size: full-size#title status: rebuilt#transmission: automatic#type: sedan
MESSAGE: awesome deal#2004 ford taurus sel; 4dr sedan#duratec 3.0l v6; w/dohc 24v#4-speed automatic transmission#front wheel drive#disc brakes; front and back#electric door-locks; w/keyless entry remote#combination keypad on drivers door for keyless entry#cruise control#power windows; steering; and brakes#power sunroof/moonroof#leather seats#front bucket; and rear bench seating#am/fm radio; w/cassette tape and 6-disc cd changer#mach surround sound audio system#dual front airbags#tilt wheel#anti-theft system#power side-mirrors#wood-tone interior trim#auto on/off headlights#tachometer#tires have plenty of tread left#rear spoiler#interstate battery is like new#intermittent wipers; w/defogger#very spacious trunk#rubberized floor mats in great condition#current mileage 127k#we bought this car in july 2009.  it was a rebuild; with a salvage title; but the gentleman who sold it to us is a trustworthy and reputable seller in our hometown in michigan.  we have driven it for 8 years; and 55;000 miles.  the thing we love about this vehicle is the engine runs very smooth.  it starts easily; and has great acceleration.  we have never had any major engine repairs.  we believe it is a reliable and trustworthy vehicle.#in full disclosure; it has had the check-engine light on for many years; and computer analysis shows it is related to the catalytic converter; however; we have been advised that since the repair would not improve the drive-ability of the car; and emissions tests are not required in this area of the country; the repair is not necessary or cost-effective.  (the computer codes found are:  p2270 and p0420)  if you are looking for a vehicle that will get you there; this is it.  it has a roomy interior; very comfortable seats; and the ac gets nice and cold.  the car has been well maintained; with oil changes approx every 3;000 miles.  here are the only issues i know of:  tears in the leather seating in two places; a very minor low-impact dent in the front-passenger fender; the cd changer does not function properly; but probably could be fixed by a knowledgeable person; and; a slow oil drip; as does almost every car this age.  the drip is not even enough to require adding oil between changes.  we simply put lucas stop-leak in at every oil change and that keeps it to a minimum.  if you are mechanical; you can replace the oil-pan gasket for the minor price of the part ($34.19 at pep boys).#this has been a great vehicle for our family; and we would not hesitate to sell it to a friend at our asking price.#note:  the ford taurus has a very high safety/crash rating; and is also rated as one of the most reliable vehicles on the road; with high performance grades.  this was a high-end taurus when new.  edmunds pricing shows:  original factory price $23;890.  current dealer price $3;107.  current private seller price $1;937.  our asking price is $1;750 cash; or best offer.    sold as-is; with no warranties.  if interested; text only to james; at#show contact info#between 8am and 9pm.

MESSAGE: selling this car for my mother.  the condition is not salvage as it has an engine thats had over $1200 dollars spent on it in the course of 3 years.  now that used to be my car; which i used to get to and from work for an extent of 3 years.  the reason i say $1200 dollars were spent on it is because when i tried to get it smoged it got several error codes; but was informed the department of motor vehicles will give you a waiver if you spend $400 dollars in repairs anything involving the vacuum system at an authorized shop. i would probably be still driving it if the waiver did not end after 3 years.  long story short somebody would have to recondition the engine to clear smog.#now i parked the car in my driveway for a year now and had to take car battery to use it on a different car.  so basically to start it a car battery is needed as i do not have one; and also some gas.#the one good thing i can think about this car is that it has a good running a/c with no leaks in the system and was charged shortly before i parked it.  it also has an aftermarket cd player i half-ass installed under the dashboard.#now the bad things old tires; although still inflated after 1 year.  front right door panel coming off;  electric window controls somewhat operational; front right door bump; paint fairly good in half the car; but front door right door paint peeling off.  will probably need new lightbulbs for the exterior lights as i have not checked and it is a likely possibility.#the glue on the dashboard is coming loose from the suns heat.  the seats are fabric may need to be washed; though i would not say their terrible.#i do not have pictures; but please do not hesitate with any question call or txt me anytime.  my name is rolando phone number is#show contact info#i know the ad says $500; but i am very aware of everything thats wrong with the car so believe me i will bend over backwards to get my mother to accept the best offer.  thank you for your time.

TITLE: 2005 ford taurus
ATTR: condition: good#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 190000#paint color: white#title status: clean#transmission: automatic
MESSAGE: this has been my car for 6 years and my parents bought it new in 2005; it had been so good to us for all of those years unfortunately it stopped driving a couple months ago (im very sad ). it broke down my last week of spring semester and i couldnt survive without a car so i was forced to buy another one. since then its just been sitting here untouched so i just want to get it out of our yard.#so the reason it stopped driving was because the torque converter went out. this part is not expensive; we just dont want to put any money or work into it. the car starts perfectly fine but like i said; it doesnt drive so it will have to be towed.#the car is old so obviously theres going to be some more minor issues - -#the door handle on the back driver side is tricky; sometimes it opens the door; sometimes it doesnt. i would have to pull it several times or open it from the inside.#the pull out ash tray (or change holder; as i used it) under the radio is missing because somebody decided to get into my car overnight and take all my change along with the tray....#the cigarette lighters went out and so did the cruise control; people have told me it most likely just needs new fuses.#one of the cup holders in the back is broken. lol just trying to get everything out there.#the heat doesnt work.. we replaced the coolant resivoir but we think it also needs a new thermostat.#we replaced the starter last summer..#the serpentine belt will need replaced somewhere down the line. they suggested it last time i got an oil change.#and finally; the tire on the front passenger side is flat. this was a brand new tire and a few days later it had a screw in it.. we patched it and now it holds air but it still drains very slowly.#the reason its being charged in the pictures is cause it has been sitting there for months.#i loved this car; despite its little flaws and am very sad that i had to get a different one. fix or get the torque converter fixed and it will be a nice running car that gets you from point a to point b; like it did for me.
